diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,215 @@
+"""Tests for rnn module."""
+
+from __future__ import absolute_import
+from __future__ import division
+from __future__ import print_function
+
+import time
+import timeit
+
+import numpy as np
+from six.moves import xrange  # pylint: disable=redefined-builtin
+
+import tensorflow as tf
+from tensorflow.python.kernel_tests import rnn_test
+
+tf.contrib.rnn.Load()
body:
I borrowed this code from:
tensorflow/contrib/tensor_forest/python/ops/training_ops.py

quote:

# Workaround for the fact that importing tensorflow imports contrib

# (even if a user isn't using this or any other contrib op), but

# there's not yet any guarantee that the shared object exists.

# In which case, "import tensorflow" will always crash, even for users that

# never use contrib.

## 

William Chan
Carnegie Mellon University
(650) 450-9455
williamchan.ca

On Wed, May 11, 2016 at 9:50 PM, ebrevdo notifications@github.com wrote:

> In tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/kernel_tests/rnn_test.py
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/2002#discussion_r62964826:
> 
> > +"""Tests for rnn module."""
> > +
> > +from **future** import absolute_import
> > +from **future** import division
> > +from **future** import print_function
> > +
> > +import time
> > +import timeit
> > +
> > +import numpy as np
> > +from six.moves import xrange  # pylint: disable=redefined-builtin
> > +
> > +import tensorflow as tf
> > +from tensorflow.python.kernel_tests import rnn_test
> > +
> > +tf.contrib.rnn.Load()
> 
> Not sure if we discussed this... why can't we just Load() inside the
> _init_ for tf.contrib.rnn?
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body_html:
I borrowed this code from:
tensorflow/contrib/tensor_forest/python/ops/training_ops.py

quote:

Workaround for the fact that importing tensorflow imports contrib

(even if a user isn't using this or any other contrib op), but

there's not yet any guarantee that the shared object exists.

In which case, "import tensorflow" will always crash, even for users that

never use contrib.

William Chan
Carnegie Mellon University
(650) 450-9455
williamchan.ca

On Wed, May 11, 2016 at 9:50 PM, ebrevdo notifications@github.com wrote:

In tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/kernel_tests/rnn_test.py
#2002 (comment):

+"""Tests for rnn module."""
+
+from future import absolute_import
+from future import division
+from future import print_function
+
+import time
+import timeit
+
+import numpy as np
+from six.moves import xrange # pylint: disable=redefined-builtin
+
+import tensorflow as tf
+from tensorflow.python.kernel_tests import rnn_test
+
+tf.contrib.rnn.Load()

Not sure if we discussed this... why can't we just Load() inside the
init for tf.contrib.rnn?

—

body_text:
I borrowed this code from:
tensorflow/contrib/tensor_forest/python/ops/training_ops.py
quote:
Workaround for the fact that importing tensorflow imports contrib
(even if a user isn't using this or any other contrib op), but
there's not yet any guarantee that the shared object exists.
In which case, "import tensorflow" will always crash, even for users that
never use contrib.

William Chan
Carnegie Mellon University
(650) 450-9455
williamchan.ca
On Wed, May 11, 2016 at 9:50 PM, ebrevdo notifications@github.com wrote:

In tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/kernel_tests/rnn_test.py
#2002 (comment):

+"""Tests for rnn module."""
+
+from future import absolute_import
+from future import division
+from future import print_function
+
+import time
+import timeit
+
+import numpy as np
+from six.moves import xrange  # pylint: disable=redefined-builtin
+
+import tensorflow as tf
+from tensorflow.python.kernel_tests import rnn_test
+
+tf.contrib.rnn.Load()

Not sure if we discussed this... why can't we just Load() inside the
init for tf.contrib.rnn?
